item.description:

item.title: Fly tip yet again by the same man, 17th July
item.description:
Hi so we have been having issues for last 2 years this same man has been fly tipping rubbish in area I do know the address of the male doing this he is taking peoples money and saying he will get rid of rubbish and dumping it all on corners of keedonwood road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Keedonwood Road, Sundridge, London

item.title: Street sweeper driver going to fast in northdown road, 17th July
item.description:
Its been reported that the street sweeper that has been doing the rounds in northdown road has been going far too fast to clean the road and is being dangerous. because he is going to fast he isn't picking anything up and there is residents that are wheelchair users and this is causing an issue. there is so many trees with berries and this is the main issues. This has happened 2 times in a row so this road hasnt been swept in about 4 weeks. Please can this be looked into urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northdown Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked pavement, 17th July
item.description:
There are three bags of rubbished dumped on pavement on entry to manor way of magpie hall lane Bromley which have been there for around three weeks. Obviously you can’t get round so you have to step onto road. Photo has been taken through passenger side wing mirror

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin have been empty but rubbish has been left, 17th July
item.description:
There are rats and flys. The bins have been empty today but all the rubbish has been left. This is not what you want in this heat we can not leave the window open because of the smell. This is visible from the main south circle road into Catford this is not a good look for Lewisham. This is a on going problem the bins need to be moved outside the flats they belong to.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Laleham Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
